page.title: 08LAMPLUGH HOUND TRAILS
page.content: A hound trail is like a fox hunt without a fox. The dogs which are especially bred for the sport, are always called hounds. The hounds have to follow a trail through differnt parts of the lake district. Two men walk around with a sent in old knitted jumpers and old socks sewn together. If the hounds worry any lambs while they are running on the trail they all have to be put down.If the hounds get lost on there trail, all until the hound has been found. All the hounds line up on the starting line, and are set off together. They are fed on meat, sterry, eggs, milk, vegetables and vitamin tablets when they are not running.
